title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Mathematical Instructional Design Simulation Modeling

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematical concepts (functions, equations) and basic computer application skills
context.additional_context: Students access real-time simulation tools via personal devices, perform collaborative activities through Zoom screen sharing, and complete assignments in 3â€“4 person groups for project-based assessments

learning_goals: Learners can apply the four main principles of cognitive load theory (intrinsic/extrinsic/germane load, element interactivity) to mathematical problem-solving scenarios.
Learners can quantitatively analyze the impact of mathematical instructional design on cognitive load using formal simulation tools.
Learners can propose optimization strategies for mathematical learning materials (problem sets, visual representations) based on simulation results.
